abstract.text: Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.

inlineContent.text: The maximum time interval the publisher can go without emitting an element, expressed in the time system of the scheduler.
The scheduler on which to deliver events.
Scheduler options that customize the delivery of elements.
A closure that executes if the publisher times out. The publisher sends the failure returned by this closure to the subscriber as the reason for termination.
A publisher that terminates if the specified interval elapses with no events received from the upstream publisher.
to terminate a publisher if an element isnâ€™t delivered within a timeout interval you specify.
elements and is configured to time out if no new elements are received within its
window of 5 seconds. A single value is published after the specified 2-second
, after which no more elements are available; the publisher then times out and completes normally.

code: execute: { subject.send("Some data - sent after a delay of \(WAIT_TIME) seconds") } )
// Prints: value: Some data - sent after a delay of 2 seconds at 2020-03-10 23:47:59 +0000

inlineContent.text: , the publisher completes normally; if you provide a closure for the
argument, the upstream publisher is instead terminated upon timeout, and the error is delivered to the downstream.

Combine-PageImage-card.png.alt: The Swift language logo, overlaid by a graph of interconnected lines and points.

abstract.text: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.
A subject that broadcasts elements to downstream subscribers.
The kind of errors this publisher might publish.
Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.
A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
A publisher that decodes elements received from an upstream publisher, using a given decoder.
Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time on a particular scheduler.
Measures and emits the time interval between events received from an upstream publisher.
Publishes either the most-recent or first element published by the upstream publisher in the specified time interval.
Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.
A publisher that terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds a specified time interval without producing an element.
A protocol that defines when and how to execute a closure.
A type that defines options accepted by the scheduler.
Describes an instant in time for this scheduler.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
A type that represents the distance between two values.
